title: About Me
content:
Hi, I’m Matt – an Electrical Engineering Technician driven by curiosity, precision, and a love for building smarter systems through real-world experimentation. I bring over six years of hands-on experience in electrical engineering and prototyping, including high-impact contributions to Navy and Department of Energy (DOE) R&D initiatives.

My proudest achievement to date: being named as an inventor on a U.S. patent application for a Vapor Quality and Vapor Volume Fraction Sensor – developed as part of a Navy Phase II contract (N6833522C0445) while working at Advanced Cooling Technologies (ACT). I led the design and prototyping of custom PCBs that enabled accurate vapor measurements in critical cooling systems, an innovation that directly supported Navy and data center cooling applications.

At ACT, I also engineered:

A vacuum chamber test system to evaluate radiation-shielding polymers for CubeSat electronics (DOE Contract DE-SC0022897)

A prototype plasma power supply used in coating methods for bipolar plates (DOE Contract DE-SC0023833)

Cryogenic and vacuum test setups used in advanced neutron optics research (DOE Contract DE-SC0025820)

Earlier in my career at Electronic Manufacturing Services Group (EMSG), I became known for my PCB troubleshooting, quality assurance, and process improvements—streamlining manufacturing workflows and mentoring junior engineers.

I’m currently pursuing a B.S. in Electrical Engineering Technology at Penn State (2023–2027) while continuing to seek out challenging, hands-on roles in research, development, and prototyping.

If you're looking for someone who can take a technical concept from idea to bench-tested prototype—with precision, grit, and a strong R&D background—let’s connect.
